patient_info: Tall stature,Mitral valve prolapse,Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy,Abnormal aortic valve morphology,Mitral regurgitation,Aortic regurgitation,Tricuspid valve prolapse,Left ventricular hypertrophy,Dyspnea,Aortic root aneurysm,Kyphoscoliosis,Tachypnea,Back pain,Exercise intolerance,Tricuspid regurgitation,Heart murmur,Chest pain
golden_diagnosis: Neonatal Marfan syndrome,Marfan syndrome,马方综合征/Marfan syndrome; MFS/Marfan syndrome,马方综合征/Marfan syndrome; MFS/Marfan syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Marfan syndrome
2. Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, type IV (vascular type)
3. Loeys-Dietz syndrome
4. Familial hypercholesterolemia with aortic valve disease
5. Aortic valve disease with concomitant mitral and tricuspid valve involvement
6. Cardiomyopathy, familial hypertrophic (specifically, Noonan syndrome with multiple valve prolapse)
7. Mitral valve prolapse syndrome with associated aortic and tricuspid valve involvement
8. Aneurysm-osteoarthritis syndrome (also known as Marfan-like syndrome)
9. Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease with cardiac manifestations
10. Stickler syndrome with cardiac involvement

Each of these conditions can present with a combination of the clinical features described in the patient's phenotype, and while some are more commonly associated with certain characteristics, the complexity of rare diseases necessitates a broad differential diagnosis.
